thread.title: New York Giants' Larry Donnell 'braces' for time in spotlight
thread.title_full: New York Giants' Larry Donnell 'braces' for time in spotlight | AL.com

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: New York Giants' Larry Donnell 'braces' for time in spotlight
text:
New York Giants tight end Larry Donnell seems to have an affinity for the NFL's prime-time games.
Just last week, the former prep star at Carroll High School in Ozark pulled down the game-winning touchdown pass with 21 seconds to play in the Giants' 30-27 victory over the San Francisco 49ers in the NFL's Sunday night game for Week 5.
Last year, Donnell caught three touchdown passes in the first half of a Thursday night game against the Washington Redskins.
The Giants step into the national spotlight again on Monday night, when they visit the Philadelphia Eagles to wrap up Week 6 of the 2015 NFL schedule. ESPN will televise the game from Philadelphia at 7:30 CDT.
RELATED: DEMECO RYANS SEES HIS 2006 SELF IN HIS NEW PHILADELPHIA EAGLES SIDEKICK
Donnell might have occasion to shine again. The Giants could be thin at wide receiver. Victor Cruz remains out with a calf injury, Odell Beckham didn't practice last week because of a hamstring injury and Rueben Randle was limited in practice because of a hamstring issue. Beckham and Randle are listed as questionable on the NFL injury report .
If Donnell has another big game, watch for his smile. It's not where he wants it to be yet, but it's one every kid who's had braces can relate to. Donnell has been seeing an orthodontist since February 2014.
"I see all these guys, everybody on TV, with nice teeth," Donnell said . "I wanted mine to look like that, too, when I was on the camera."
Donnell talked to Stu Woo of the Wall Street Journal for his piece on braces-wearing NFL players .
FOR MORE OF AL.COM'S COMPREHENSIVE COVERAGE OF THE NFL, GO TO OUR NFL PAGE
Donnell said the hardest part of braces is keeping his weight up on the days after they're tightened. The 6-foot-6 Donnell is listed on the New York roster as weighing 265 pounds.
"I definitely don't eat for about two days," Donnell said . "When I get that feeling back, you better believe I'm grubbing."
Donnell has caught 21 passes for 154 yards and two touchdowns for the Giants this season.
RELATED: STATE NFL ROUNDUP: PHILIP RIVERS MARKS MILESTONE WITH HISTORIC PERFORMANCE
